ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] error converting chemkin input files
ygData.msgSnippet: Ulf, My guess is that you have a species name that has a colon ( : ) in it. The statement that produces the error message implicitly assumes that no species

Ulf,

My guess is that you have a species name that has a colon (':') in it.   
The statement that produces the error message implicitly assumes that  
no species name contains a colon. I will modify it to remove this  
restriction, In the meantime, if you change the species names the  
problem should go away.

Dave



On Friday, September 19, 2003, at 06:04 AM, usenechal wrote:

> Dear Prof. Goodwin,
>
> some of my chemkin-input files are producing the following error
> while converting to xml:
>
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "./.cttmp.py", line 8, in ?
>     execfile(file)
>   File "./nist_HFC_plusthermo.cti", line 21, in ?
>     pressure = OneAtm)    )
>   File "C:\PROGRA~1\Python23\Lib\site-
> packages\Cantera\ctml_writer.py", line 932
> , in __init__
>     initial_state, options)
>   File "C:\PROGRA~1\Python23\Lib\site-
> packages\Cantera\ctml_writer.py", line 802
> , in __init__
>     datasrc, spnames = sp.split(':')
> ValueError: unpack list of wrong size
>
> Ck2cti works without problems but the conversion to xml produces this
> error. I tried it manually with cti2ctml but it gives the same
> error . What's wrong ? The files worked in previous cantera-versions
> and are relatively big (5 elems, 127 species, 1200 reactions, 130kB),
> but if you want I can send it to you.
>
>
> best regards
> ulf senechal
